wikipedia_page.main: Edith Margaret Hannam (née Boucher; 28 November 1878 – 16 January 1951) was a female tennis player from Great Britain. She played at the 1912 Summer Olympics and won two gold medals.

response: | style="background:#98fb98;" | Win || 1914 || Wimbledon || Grass ||  Agnes Morton ||  Edith Hannam   Ethel Thomson Larcombe || 6–1, 6–3
| |Outdoor:   Dorothea Köring   Heinrich Schomburgk  Indoor:   Edith Hannam   Charles Dixon

She won the singles title in 1908, beating Marjorie Dodd in the final. She was runner-up in 1907 (to future International Tennis Hall of Fame enshrinee May Sutton), and in 1909 (to Edith Hannam of Great Britain).
